prompt: Why am I not receiving any notifications in XWiki.
expected_answer: Make sure that notifications are enabled. You can enable them by setting the `notifications.enabled` setting in `xwiki.properties` to `true`. Further, ensure that you're subscribed to the pages or users you want to receive notifications for. You can watch a page, a page and its children, or an entire wiki. To watch a location, all you need is to go to that place, and then click on the "alert" menu (represented by a bell) and enable the desired notifications. To follow a user, if you go to the profile of an user, using the User Index for example, you can see decide to watching a user. It means you will receive all notifications about events triggered by this user. In your user profile, if you go to the "network" tab, you can see the list of users you are watching and the events that have been performed by them.
ai_answer:
Sources: https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/ 
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/RSS 
https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications 


There could be several reasons why you're not receiving notifications in XWiki. Here are some possibilities and solutions:

1. **Default Settings**:
   - If you are a new user on XWiki version 15.5 or later, by default, nothing is watched, although all application types are enabled. You need to start watching something to begin receiving notifications. For versions prior to 15.5, the whole wiki is watched by default, but no application types are enabled except specific ones like Mentions.

2. **Notification Preferences**:
   - Ensure that you have enabled the types of notifications you want to receive. You can manage this in your notification settings by selecting different event types (e.g., when a page is created, a blog post is published, etc.). You can access these settings through the notifications menu.

3. **Notification Filters**:
   - Check if there are any active filters that might be preventing notifications. For instance, filters for hidden pages or minor events might stop you from receiving certain notifications. You can manage and disable these filters in the "Advanced filtering options" of your notification settings.

4. **Watching Users or Pages**:
   - Make sure you are watching the users or pages you are interested in to receive notifications about their activities. You can do this by visiting user profiles and choosing to follow them.

5. **Email Settings**:
   - If you're expecting email notifications, verify that your email settings are configured correctly. Also, check the frequency at which you receive emails, as this might be set to a lower frequency like daily or weekly.

6. **Check Admin Settings**:
   - If you are an administrator, ensure that the default settings for notifications are correctly configured in the administration panel. You can specify which events should trigger notifications for all users by default.

If none of these solutions resolve your issue, there might be a technical problem or a specific configuration issue in your XWiki instance. In such cases, consulting the system administrator or referring to the XWiki documentation for troubleshooting steps might be necessary.

sources.content:
### Follow a user

If you go to the [profile of an user](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Profile%20Application), using the [User Index](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Directory%20Application) for example, you can see decide to watching a user. It means you will receive all notifications about events triggered by this user.

![watchUser01.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser01.png?rev=1.3)  
![watchUser02.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser02.png?rev=1.3)  
![watchUser03.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser03.png?rev=1.3)  
![watchUser04.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/watchUser04.png?rev=1.3)

In your user profile, if you go to the "network" tab, you can see the list of users you are watching and the events that have performed:

![FollowedUsers.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/FollowedUsers.png?rev=1.4)

### Default Watch Settings

XWiki <15.5 By default for new users the whole wiki is watched. However, by default in this version, there's no application type enabled for notifications, except specific ones like Mention. This means that new users won't receive notifications, until they started to watch something and enabled some applciation types. There is a mechanism to automatically enable some application types whenever the users perform editions.

XWiki 15.5+ Starting with this version, by default nothing is watched for new users. However, all application types are now enabled. So users will keep not receiving anything, until they started to watch something.

![notifications-filters-settings.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notifications-filters-settings.png?rev=1.4)  
![notification-add-filter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notification-add-filter.png?rev=1.1)



XWiki 14.1+ Note that the "System Event" filter doesn't filter out events that target the user *explicitly*.

### Hidden (technical) pages

**Filters that concern hidden pages are not shown in the table**, unless you have [enabled the option to see hidden pages](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/User%20Profile%20Application#HEditPreferences). That is why you can end up in a situation where filters exist but are not listed there.

### Filter your own events

By default, one don't receive notification about one's own activity (XWiki 14.1+ unless the event that triggered the notification targets *explicitly* that user). You have the ability to disable this filter in the "Advanced filtering options" section of your own notification settings. It's a per user setting, not a global one.

![OwnEventFilter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/OwnEventFilter.png?rev=1.3)

### Filter events that you have marked as read

You can hide the notifications that you have marked as "read", so they won't appear anymore in the notifications menu nor in the emails.

![NotificationReadFilter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationReadFilter.png?rev=1.3)

### Filter minor events

Minor events are not displayed on the notifications. But you can disable this filter.

![FilterMinorEvent.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/FilterMinorEvent.png?rev=1.3)

#-# - all:   everytime a user makes a change on a page, it is automatically added to her list of watched pages.  
#-# - major: everytime a user makes a major change on a page, it is automatically added to her list of watched pages.  
#-# - new:   only pages created by a user are added to her list of watched pages.  
#-#  
#-# The default is :  
# notifications.watchedEntities.autoWatch = major## Customizing the notification email template

The template used for email notifications is customizable. It is stored in an XWiki.Mail object inside the page XWiki.Notifications.MailTemplate.

It is possible to attach images to that templates, and they will be embedded in the notifications email.

To display them in the email, you need to use the syntax <img src="cid:myImage.png" /> in the HTML xproperty (for the Text xproperty, you'll need to decide what you want to display but it can't be an image since that's not textual ![emoticon_wink](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/resources/icons/silk/emoticon_wink.png?cache-version=1711538036000)).

## Create global notification filters

XWiki 13.3+ Administrators are now able to create custom notification filters globally: it means those filters will be copied to any new users registered on the wiki. Existing users won't have any changes when the filters are modified. 

![notificationsSystemFiltersPreferences.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notificationsSystemFiltersPreferences.png?rev=1.2)  
![notificationsCustomFiltersPreferences.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notificationsCustomFiltersPreferences.png?rev=1.3)



# Developers

## Send notifications

See [Tutorial: How to send notifications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Module/#HTutorial:Howtosendnotifications).

**Contents*** [Available Feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/RSS#HAvailableFeeds)
* [Customized RSS Feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/RSS#HCustomizedRSSFeeds)
RSS Feeds can be used to get notification from activity taking place on an XWiki instance.

# Available Feeds

Several RSS feeds are provided by default and it is possible to create new ones easily when required. The default wiki (extensions might provide more) provides the following RSS feeds:

* Feed for all modified pages. This is available from the [Notifications Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/).
* Feed for all Blog posts. This is available if your wiki has the [Blog application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Blog%20Application) installed.
* Feeds for Search results. This is available if your wiki has the [Search application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Search%20Application) installed.
* Feeds on Tags. This is available if your wiki has the [Tag application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Tag%20Application) installed.
* The [Watchlist Feature](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Watchlist%20Application) allows you to get a RSS feed of all the modifications to the pages in your Watchlist.

Note that you can choose to start receiving information from the Blog and modified pages feeds by using your browser's RSS notification button. For example on Firefox:

![rss.png](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/RSS/rss.png?rev=1.1)

## Get a notification RSS feed

You can get a RSS feed of the notifications occurring in your wiki. This feed can be accessed either through a link in your notification tray (or at the bottom of the notifications macro).

![NotificationTrayRSSLink.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationTrayRSSLink.png?rev=1.3)  
![NotificationsWithRSS.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsWithRSS.png?rev=1.3)

## Notifications Macro

The [Notifications Macro is provided by its own application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Macro/).

# Settings

On the notifications menu, you also have a link to go to the "settings" of the notifications.

![notif4.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif4.png?rev=1.8)

By default, users only get notifications when they are mentioned or when actions are performed on pages they created or updated. For receiving other notifications, you need to select which "types" of notifications you want to receive. When a page is created? When a blog post is published?

You can enable or disable all notification types that belong to a particular application by clicking on the bells associated to this application. If some types are enabled and other are disabled inside an application, the switch looks like the next screenshot, meaning that the application's notifications are partially enabled:

![NotifUndeterminate.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotifUndeterminate.png?rev=1.3)

Note that you only receive notifications that occur after you turn on the notifications types.

There are several ways you can be notified in XWiki:

* [Notifications Application](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HNotificationsApplication)
* [Share Page by mail](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HSharePagebymail)
* [RSS Feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HRSSFeeds)
* [Mentions](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HMentions)
* [What's New](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/Notifications#HWhat27sNew)

# Notifications Application

XWiki 9.3+ You can receive [notifications](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Notifications%20Application/) in the top bar, under the Alert entry (represented by a bell).

[![notif2.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?width=650&rev=1.5)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)



# Share Page by mail

The [Share Page Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Share%20Page%20Application) allows sending a page by mail to someone (another user of the wiki or any email address).

![sharePageDialog.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Share%20Page%20Application/sharePageDialog.png?rev=1.1)

# RSS Feeds

You can also get notification from activity taking place on an XWiki instance [using RSS feeds](https://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Documentation/UserGuide/Features/RSS).

# Mentions

XWiki 12.5+ You can get notified when somebody mentions you in pages, comments, or fields supporting xwiki syntax, see [Mentions Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Mentions%20Application/).

# What's New

XWiki 15.1+ The [What's New Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WhatsNewUI/) allows you to get notified about news regarding XWiki.

# Administrators

Administrators can go to Administration > Notifications to configure some settings about the notifications.

![NotificationsAdministration.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsAdministration.png?rev=1.5)

Some properties can be overridden by users. The inheritance is "Main Wiki preferences < Current Wiki preferences < User preferences".

XWiki 13.2+ Administrators can also directly change users' notification settings by going to their profile and click on "Notifications" tab in the menu. The UI is the same as what the user is seeing to customize their own notification settings.

## Enabling notifications for all users by default

In the administration, you can select which application and/or event types should be enabled by default for all users. 

## Choosing the default frequency of notification emails

XWiki 14.10+ Administrators can select the default frequency used for sending emails to users about the changes that have happened on the wiki. This frequency is set to *Daily* by default.

## Choosing the default level of details about the changes in the email

Administrators can select the level of details that users receive on the email, about the changes that have happened to the wiki.

## Choosing the default auto-watched mode

Administrators can select what is the default auto watching page behavior.

![AutoWatchModeAdmin.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/AutoWatchModeAdmin.png?rev=1.3)

You can also edit the xwiki.properties file:

#-# [Since 9.11.8]  
#-# [Since 10.6RC1]  
#-# The automatic watch mode used by default. The value can be changed by an administrator in the wiki's administration  
#-# or by any user in their own settings.  
#-#  
#-# Possible values:  
#-#  
#-# - none:  no page is added to the list of watched pages automatically.

# Description

This application contributes content in the Alert menu (contributed by the [Alerts Application](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Alerts%20Application/)) in the top bar, represented by a bell:

![Notifications.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/Notifications.png?rev=1.4)

You can find under this menu the notifications about some events happening on the wiki (a page has been modified, a new blog post has been posted, etc...).

The number of notifications is displayed on the top menu, just above the bell:

![notif1.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif1.png?rev=1.5)

If you have more than 20 unread notifications, you will not see the real count but this instead:

![MaxCounter.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/MaxCounter.png?rev=1.3)

When you open the menu, the content of the notifications is loaded:

![NotificationsLoading.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsLoading.png?rev=1.3)

Then you can see the list of notifications:

[![notif2.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/notif2.png?rev=1.5)![NotificationsMacro.png](https://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/Extension/Notifications%20Application/WebHome/NotificationsMacro.png?rev=1.3)

If you click on the little button with the "check" icon, you mark the notification as "read". In the future, you will be able to select either you want to see only unread notifications or all of them.

When the notification is read, the button disappear and the background color changes:
